1442.01 BUILDING PERMIT REQUIRED; EXCEPTIONS; MAINTENANCE OF APPROVED ITEMS.
   (a)   Residential structures.
      (1)   A building permit shall be obtained prior to the initiation of
construction of any new structure, any addition to an existing structure, any
structural alteration to an existing structure, or any driveway, sidewalk or
other concrete flat work, any portion of which lies within the public right-of-
way, or prior to moving or demolishing any structure. This requirement shall
apply to all structures, whether inspected by the State or the City.
      (2)   A permit shall be obtained prior to the installation of any major
heating or air conditioning appliance or equipment, including solid fuel
burning equipment. A permit shall also be obtained prior to the installation or
major alteration of any electrical circuit.
      (3)   A permit is not required for ordinary repair or normal maintenance,
so long as no structural alterations are made. A permit is not required for
ordinary repair or normal maintenance of any installed appliance or equipment.
      (4)   Once any structural element, material, appliance, equipment or part
of the electrical system is approved by a building inspector, the same shall be
maintained in the same state of safe operation as it was when it was approved.
Upon evidence to the contrary, a building inspector may order the repair,
alteration or replacement of the items which are not so maintained.
   (b)   Commercial structures.  
      (1)   A building permit shall be obtained for any of the following:
         A.   The construction or alteration of any building, including
accessory buildings.
         B.   The change in an existing building or accessory building to a use
of a different building classification.
         C.   The cutting away of any wall, partition or portions of walls; the
removal or cutting of any structural beam or load bearing support.
         D.   The removal or change of any required element of accessibility,
means of egress or rearrangement of parts of a structure affecting the egress
requirements.
         E.   The addition to, alteration of, replacement or relocation of any
standpipe, water supply, sewer drainage, drains leader, gas, soil, waste, vent
or similar piping.
         F.   The addition to or alteration of, replacement or relocation of
electrical wiring or mechanical or other work affecting public health or
general safety.
      (2)   A building permit is not required for minor repair of a structure
as defined in
Chapter 1420 or for ordinary repair or normal maintenance of any installed
appliance, equipment or part of the electrical system.
   (c)   Once any structural element, material, appliance, equipment or part of
the electrical system is approved by a building inspector, the same shall be
maintained in the same state of safe operation as it was when it was approved.
Upon evidence to the contrary, a building inspector may order the repair,
alteration or replacement of the items which are not so maintained and may
require said change to follow the permit process.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1442.02 PERMIT APPLICATION.
   An application for a permit, signed by the owner or his or her authorized
agent, shall be filed with the Director of Public Service and Safety, or his or
her designee, on a form furnished by the City.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1442.03 PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS.
   (a)   Two copies of plans, with specifications, either on drawings or as a
separate document, shall accompany each application. A site plan shall also be
submitted indicating the location of the structure with all of the required
setback dimensions shown and stamped by a professional surveyor/engineer. All
plans submitted shall show all phases of construction, drawn to scale. Such
document shall contain sufficient information to show that the proposed work
will conform to the provisions of the Building and Housing Code and all
applicable laws, ordinances, rules and regulations. Each set of plans and
descriptive information shall give the address of the work site, the lot
identification of the work site, and the name and address of the owner and of
the person who prepared the plans. The Director of Public Service and Safety,
or his or her designee, may waive the requirement for filing plans when the
work involved is of a minor nature and/or the building plan is adequately
described in the application.
   (b)   Sufficient data to show the adequacy of the design shall be submitted
when required by the Director of Public Service and Safety, or his or her
designee. The Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee may
accept an affidavit from a registered architect or registered professional
engineer, stating that the design conforms to the provisions of the Building
and Housing Code, and may thereafter waive the plan review fee under Section
1442.08.
   (c)   All contractors shall be registered with the City Engineering
department prior to the issuance of any permit per
Chapter 1444.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1442.04 PERMIT ISSUANCE.
   Action by the Director of Public Service and Safety, or his or her designee
in either issuing or refusing to issue a permit will be taken, except in
unusual circumstances, within three working days of the time that a completed
application is filed with the necessary plans, specifications and permit fee.
   (a)   Approval. If the Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her
designee is satisfied that the work described in an application for a permit
and in the plans and specifications filed therewith conforms to and complies
with the requirements of the Building and Housing Code and other pertinent laws
and ordinances, then on payment of the required fee, he or she shall issue or
authorize the issuance of a permit.
   (b)   Disapproval. If the application for a permit, and the plans and
specifications filed therewith, describe work which does not conform to the
requirements of the Building and Housing Code or other pertinent laws or
ordinances, or which does not contain sufficient information, the Director of
Public Service and Safety or his or her designee shall not issue a permit but
shall return the plans and specifications to the applicant with his or her
refusal to issue such permit. The Director of Public Service and Safety or his
or her designee shall give, in writing, such reasons for rejection as he or she
deems sufficient.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1442.05 PERMIT CONDITIONS; LIABILITY OF DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC SERVICE AND SAFETY.
   (a)   A permit issued shall be construed as permission to proceed with the
work. It shall not be construed as authority to violate, cancel, alter or set
aside any of the provisions of the Building and Housing Code or other
applicable laws, ordinances, rules or regulations, nor shall such issuance of a
permit prevent the Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee
from thereafter requiring a correction of errors in plans or in construction,
or of violations of the Building and Housing Code or other applicable laws,
ordinances, rules or regulations.
   (b)   The Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee shall
not incur any personal liability or expense or impose any liability or expense
upon the City by virtue of his or her prior approval of any plans or
specification later determined by him or her or any other authority to be in
contravention of the Building and Housing Code or other applicable laws,
ordinances, rules or regulations.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1442.06 PERMIT TIME LIMITATIONS.
   A building permit shall become invalid if the work authorized by it is not
commenced within six months of its issuance, or if the work is suspended or
abandoned for a period of one year from the date of such issuance, or if the
work is not completed in a period of one year after the date of such issuance.
If the work is not completed within one year the applicant must resubmit the
required information with all applicable fees to apply. However, for cause, one
or more extensions of time, for periods not exceeding ninety days each, may be
allowed by written permission of the Director of Public Service and Safety or
his or her designee.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1442.07 PARTIAL PERMITS.
   A partial permit will be issued when an application for construction is made
and a portion of the project is to be temporarily left unfinished. A new permit
must be applied for before the balance of the work is performed.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1442.08 FEE SCHEDULE; WORK WITHOUT PERMIT.
   (a)   The plan review, permit or inspection fees set forth herein shall be
collected by the Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee
and shall be collected in full prior to the issuance of any permit. When a
building is to be constructed or remodeled, the general contractor shall assume
complete responsibility for all phases of the construction, including, but not
limited to, those phases completed by subcontractors. Fees shall be computed
according to the following schedule:
   Fee Schedule
   (1)   Standard fees.
      A.   Plan review.
         1.   Structural:   $1.00    per 100 square feet w/min. of $10.00 fee
         2.   Electrical:   $1.00    per 100 square feet w/min. of $10.00 fee
         3.   Plumbing:   $2.00 per trap - no minimum
         4.   HVAC:   $1.00 per 200 square feet w/min. of $5.00 fee
      B.   Permit.
         1.   Structural:   $1.00    per 100 square feet w/min. of $10.00 fee
         2.   Electrical:   $1.00    per 100 square feet w/min. of $10.00 fee
         3.   Plumbing:   $2.00 per trap - no minimum
         4.   HVAC:   $1.00 per 200 square feet w/min. of $5.00 fee
      C.   Inspection.
         1.   Structural:   $2.00    per 100 square feet w/min. of $15.00 fee
         2.   Electrical:   $2.00    per 100 square feet w/min. of $10.00 fee
         3.   Plumbing:   $4.00 per trap - no minimum
         4.   HVAC:   $1.00 per 100 square feet w/min. of $5.00 fee
   Area is calculated on outside dimensions of each level of the structure,
excluding basements.
   (2)   Swimming pools.
         Above ground                  $15.00
         In or on ground               $30.00
         Temporary private swimming pools         $5.00
      (3)   Sign permits. (See Section
1490.02 of these Codified Ordinances.)
      (4)   Contractor's registration fee. $20.00   per year (See Section
1444.05 of these Codified Ordinances.)
      (5)   Exemption. Structures without foundations and not more than 200
square feet of floor area shall be exempt from the structural portion of the
Standard Fee Schedule, but shall be subject to the electrical, plumbing and
HVAC portions of said Standard Fee Schedule when applicable. To be considered
as a structure without foundations, the following criteria must be met:
         A.   Less than 200 square feet of floor area.
         B.   A detached structure.
         C.   Placed on a solid floor of either pressure-treated weather-
resistant wood, or on concrete.
         D.   When placed on a wood floor, the wood floor must be supported by
a minimum of two 4-inch by 4-inch pressure-treated runners or equivalent; when
placed on a concrete floor the structure must be anchored to the floor at each
corner and along each side, not to exceed six feet apart.
         E.   Total height of the structure shall not exceed 12 feet above
ground level.
         F.   No opening shall exceed 84 inches or seven feet in width.
         G.   No roof overhang shall exceed 16 inches beyond the building
walls.
         H.   The structure shall not be used as a living quarters nor to house
or store automobiles or trucks.
         I.   This criteria shall apply to any on-lot detached structure
including "play houses" and "recreational structures".
         J.   Subject to the standard zoning fee and set back requirements as
listed in Part Twelve of the Codified Ordinances of Wapakoneta.
   (b)   Where work for which a permit is required by the Building and Housing
Code is started prior to obtaining such permit, and where no emergency is
involved, the fees required for such permit shall be doubled. The payment of
such double fee shall not relieve any person from fully complying with the
requirements of the Building and Housing Code or any law of the State or
ordinance of the City.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2004-22. Passed 5-17-04; Ord. 2005-50. Passed
1-5-06; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1442.09 REVOCATION OF PERMIT OR APPROVAL.
   The Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee may revoke
a permit or approval issued under the provisions of the Building and Housing
Code where there has been any false statement or misrepresentation as to a
material fact in the application or plans on which the permit or approval was
based.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1442.10 CERTIFICATES OF OCCUPANCY.
   (a)   A certificate of occupancy shall be obtained from the Director of
Public Service and Safety or his or her designee as described below in
paragraphs (b), (c) and (d) except projects that will be issued a certificate
of occupancy by the Ohio Department of Commerce Division of Industrial
Compliance.
   (b)   No vacant land shall be occupied or used, and no structure hereafter
erected, structurally altered or changed in use shall be used or changed in
use, until a certificate of occupancy has been issued by the Director of Public
Service and Safety or his or her designee.
   (c)   A certificate of occupancy, either for the whole or part of a new
building or for alteration of an existing building, shall be applied for
coincident with the application for a building permit and shall be issued
within five working days after the erection or alteration of such building or
part thereof has been completed in conformity with the provision of the Zoning
Code, the Building and Housing Code, the Subdivision Regulations and any other
applicable law or ordinance.
   (d)   A certificate of occupancy for the use or occupancy of vacant land,
for a change in the use of land or for a change in the use of an existing
building shall be applied for and issued before any such land is occupied or
used or before such land or building is changed in use. Such certificate shall
be issued within five working days after application has been made therefor,
provided that such proposed use is in conformity with the provisions of the
Zoning Code.
   (e)   A certificate of occupancy shall be applied for through the Ohio
Department of Commerce, Division of Industrial Compliance per requirements of
the Ohio Building Code for any change of use in any commercial structure that
changes the use of what the building is currently approved. If no certificate
of occupancy currently exists for a commercial structure, it may be required by
the Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee to be
obtained.
   (f)   Upon the completion of project for which a certificate of occupancy is
issued by the Ohio Department of Commerce, Division of Industrial Compliance, a
copy of said certificate of occupancy shall be provided to the Director of
Public Service and Safety or his or her designee.
   (g)   A record of all certificates of occupancy shall be filed with the
Director or his or her designee with a copy for the Wapakoneta Fire Department.
   (h)   No fee shall be collected for a certificate of occupancy.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07; Ord. 2008-28. Passed
6-16-08.)
1442.11 PERMITS AND CERTIFICATES ISSUED UPON FALSE PRETENSES.
   Any permit or certificate issued under a false statement shall be void.
Whenever the fact of such false statement shall be established, said
certificate shall be revoked by notice in writing to be delivered to the holder
of the void certificate concerned or in some conspicuous place upon the
premises. Any person who shall proceed thereafter with any work or use without
having obtained a new permit or certificate in accordance with this chapter
shall be deemed to be guilty of a violation of this chapter.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1442.12 ZONING CERTIFICATE REQUIREMENTS; FEES.
   (a)   Building contractors proposing to construct a structure which requires
a State issued building permit shall be required to apply to the Zoning
Administrative Officer or the Director of Public Service and Safety, or his or
her designee, for a zoning permit prior to the commencement of construction. A
zoning permit fee shall be collected prior to issuance of a permit. Said fee
shall be calculated at the rate of two dollars ($2.00) per one thousand dollars
($1,000) of the estimated cost up to twenty thousand dollars ($20,000), plus
one dollar ($1.00) per one thousand dollars ($1,000) of cost in excess of
twenty thousand dollars ($20,000) up to and including one hundred thousand
dollars ($100,000), plus fifty cents ($0.50) per one thousand dollars ($1,000)
of the estimated cost in excess of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000).
   (b)   Zoning certificates shall be required prior to the commencement of
construction of any new residence or expansion of an existing residence. Zoning
certificate fees shall be calculated at a base rate of five dollars ($5.00),
plus an additional square footage fee of one dollar ($1.00) per 100 square feet
of floor area, with a maximum of thirty dollars ($30.00). Floor area shall be
based on the outside dimensions of the new structure or area of expansion.
(Ord. 92-69. Passed 10-7-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1442.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
1440.99 for general Building Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)

   CROSS REFERENCES
   Power to license electricians, plumbers, etc. - see Ohio R.C. 715.27
   Construction Industry Examining Board - see Ohio R.C. 4740.01 et seq.

Ch. 1442
1444.01 REGISTRATION REQUIRED.
   No general building code contractor, plumbing, electrical, heating, piping,
sewer building, air conditioning or refrigeration contractor, building
tradesman or repairman, or any other individual offering such services for a
fee, other than as an employee of a contractor, shall perform any work within
the City of Wapakoneta without first obtaining a contractor's registration from
the Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1444.02 REGISTRATION CATEGORIES.
   A contractor's registration shall be issued for each of the following
categories: electrical, HVAC, plumbing or structural and non-structural.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1444.03 EXAMINATION; DISQUALIFICATION; EXEMPTION.
   For each registration desired, a contractor shall submit references, pass a
test of basic knowledge and provide adequate evidence of experience or State
license for the category. Application for a contractor's registration shall be
upon a form issued by the City. Evidence of repeated violations of the Building
and Housing Code or other ordinances shall be sufficient evidence to disqualify
the applicant from receiving a contractor's registration. The applicant need
not be tested if he or she submits proof of valid certification from the State
or a political subdivision of the State that has testing requirements
comparable to the City's.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1444.04 APPEALS.
   Any applicant to whom a contractor's registration has been denied may appeal
such decision to the Board of Building Code Appeals, whose decision shall be
final.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1444.05 EFFECTIVE PERIOD; RENEWAL; FEE.
   Each contractor's registration shall be valid for the calendar year in which
it is issued and shall be renewed annually thereafter. An annual registration
fee of twenty dollars ($20.00) shall be submitted with the application for each
contractor's registration.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1444.06 NOTICE OF VIOLATIONS, REVOCATION OF REGISTRATION.
   (a)   The Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee shall
give any contractor a notice, in writing, of any violation of the Building and
Housing Code or any ordinance or other law, rule or regulation of the City.
Such notice shall instruct such contractor to report to the Director of Public
Service and Safety or his or her designee in regard to the violation and shall
inform the contractor of the amount of the fee authorized under Section
1444.99.
   (b)   A contractor's registration may be revoked at any time by the Director
of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee for violation of the
Building and Housing Code or any ordinance or other law, rule or regulation of
the City.
(Ord. 99-30. Passed 7-19-99; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1444.07 BOND REQUIRED FOR WORK IN PUBLIC RIGHT-OF-WAY.
   All contractors, including utility companies, working within a public right-
of-way, shall be bonded in the minimum amount of five thousand dollars
($5,000). Evidence of such bond shall be submitted to the Director of Public
Service and Safety or his or her designee prior to commencement of any work
within the City.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1444.08 PARTIAL EXEMPTION FOR HOMEOWNERS WORKING ON THEIR OWN PROPERTY.
   The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to a homeowner as an
individual desiring to perform work on his or her own premises, or on other
property which he or she owns in the City, provided, however, that such
individual shall take and pass the test of basic knowledge for each of the
aforementioned testing categories in which he or she wishes to perform work.
Any work performed by such homeowner shall be subject to all other provisions
of the Building and Housing Code and to all inspections authorized.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1444.99 PENALTY.
   (a)   Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, whoever violates any of
the provisions of this chapter shall pay a fee as follows:
      (1)   Except as otherwise provided in this section, a fee of two hundred
dollars ($200.00);
      (2)   If, within one year of the violation, the contractor previously has
been notified of one violation of the Building and Housing Code or any
ordinance or other law, rule or regulation of the City, a fee of three hundred
dollars ($300.00);
      (3)   If, within one year of the violation, the contractor previously has
been notified of two or more violations of the Building and Housing Code or any
ordinance or other law, rule or regulation of the City, a fee of three hundred
dollars ($300.00) and, additionally, the contractor's registration shall be
revoked for a period of not less than six months.
   (b)   Payment of the fees authorized under this section shall be made at the
City Engineering Department. If payment of a fee is not made within ten days
from the date of issuance of the violation notice, the contractor may be issued
a citation or complaint to appear in court for the violation. The offense shall
constitute a misdemeanor of the third degree and the offender shall be subject
to the penalty provided in Section
1440.99.
(Ord. 99-30. Passed 7-19-99; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
CHAPTER 1446
Board of Building Code Appeals
1446.01   Establishment; membership; vacancies; absences; quorum; conflicts of
interest; compensation.
1446.02   Meetings, records and procedure.
1446.03   Powers.
1446.04   Appeals.
   CROSS REFERENCES
   Appeals from orders of administrative officers and agencies - see Ohio R.C.
Ch. 2506
   Building inspections - see B. & H.
1440.01 et seq.
   Appeals from denial of registration of contractors - see B. & H.
1444.04
   Appeals of orders to raze or repair buildings - see B. & H.
1468.06
1446.01 ESTABLISHMENT; MEMBERSHIP; VACANCIES; ABSENCES; QUORUM; CONFLICTS OF
INTEREST; COMPENSATION.
   (a)   There is hereby established within the City a board to be known as the
Board of Building Code Appeals, consisting of five members who shall be
appointed by Council.
   (b)   Two members of the Board shall be appointed for a term of one year,
two members for a term of two years, and one member for a term of three years.
Upon expiration of the term of office of a member of the Board, his or her
successor shall be appointed for a term of three years. A vacancy shall be
filled for an unexpired term in the manner in which the original appointments
are required to be made. Continued absence by any member from regular meetings
of the Board shall render any such member liable for immediate removal from
office.
   (c)   Three members of the Board shall constitute a quorum. In varying the
application of any provision of the Building and Housing Code, or in modifying
any order of the Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee,
affirmative votes of three members shall be required.
   (d)   No member shall vote upon any question in which he or she has a
financial or personal interest, either directly or indirectly.
   (e)   Members of the Board will serve without pay.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1446.02 MEETINGS, RECORDS AND PROCEDURE.
   (a)   Meetings of the Board of Building Code Appeals shall be held at the
call of the Chairperson and at such other times as the Board may determine. All
hearings before the Board shall be open to the public. The Board shall keep
minutes of its proceedings, showing the vote of each member upon every
question, or the absence or failure to vote of each member upon every question,
and shall also keep records of its examinations and other official actions.
Such minutes and records shall be public records.
   (b)   The Board shall establish rules and regulations of its own procedure
which are consistent with the provisions of the Building and Housing Code.
Board members shall, annually, by majority vote, select one of their number to
serve as Chairperson and one to serve as Secretary. Such officers shall hold
office for a term of one year or until their successors are elected and
qualified.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1446.03 POWERS.
   The Board of Building Code Appeals shall have the power, subject to
limitations and in a manner set forth in the Building and Housing Code, to:
   (a)   Affirm or reverse, in whole or in part, or modify, any decision of the
Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee in interpreting
the provisions of the Building and Housing Code;
   (b)   Vary the application of any provision of the Building and Housing Code
to any particular case when, in its opinion, enforcement thereof would be
manifest injustice and/or would be contrary to the spirit and the purpose of
the Building and Housing Code or the public interest;
   (c)   Determine if any material or method of construction may be used, even
though not specifically authorized by the Building and Housing Code, and
specify the manner in which such materials and methods shall be used; and
   (d)   Determine any requirement for the strength or stability of an existing
or proposed building or structure, or for the safety or health of the occupants
thereof, not specifically covered by the Building and Housing Code or not
readily interpretable from the provisions of the Building and Housing Code.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2007-37. Passed 9-17-07.)
1446.04 APPEALS. 
   (a)   Any person, any Municipal officer or official, or any public body
aggrieved by an action of the Director of Public Service and Safety or his or
her designee, may take an appeal to the Board of Building Code Appeals. The
Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee, any Municipal
officer or official, any public body, or any member of the Board of Building
Code Appeals, may request a hearing by the Board on any subject over which such
Board has jurisdiction or power, as set forth in the Building and Housing Code,
or may request the Board to review or interpret any provision of the Building
and Housing Code.
   (b)   An appeal shall be made within ten days from the date of the decision
appealed by filing with the Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her
designee and with the Board a notice of appeal, specifying the grounds
therefore, and by paying a fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) with the Director of
Public Service and Safety or his or her designee. The Director of Public
Service and Safety or his or her designee shall forthwith transmit to the Board
all the papers pertaining to the decision from which the appeal was made. Any
expense of the Board in evaluating the merits of an appeal shall be borne by
the appellant.
   (c)   The Board shall fix a reasonable time for the hearing of an appeal,
give public notice thereof, and at least ten days notice to the parties of
interest, and decide upon the appeal within a reasonable time after it is
submitted. At the hearing, any party may appear in person, or by his or her
agent or attorney.
   (d)   The Board shall, in every case, reach a decision without unreasonable
or unnecessary delay. Every decision of the Board shall be in writing and shall
indicate the vote upon a decision. Every decision shall be promptly filed with
the office of the Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her designee
and shall be open to public inspection. A certified copy shall be sent by mail
or otherwise to the appellant or other interested party, and a copy shall be
kept publicly posted in the office of the Director of Public Service and Safety
or his or her designee for two weeks after filing.
   (e)   The Board, after a public hearing, may vary the application of any
provision of the Building and Housing Code to any particular case when, in its
opinion, enforcement thereof would be manifest injustice and/or would be
contrary to the spirit and purpose of the Building and Housing Code or the
public interest, or when, in its opinion, the interpretation of the Director of
Public Service and Safety or his or her designee should be modified or
reversed. A decision of the Board to vary the application of any provision of
the Building and Housing Code or to modify an order of the Director of Public
Service and Safety or his or her designee shall specify in what manner such
variation or modification is made, the conditions upon which it is made and the
reasons therefore.
   (f)   If a decision of the Board reverses or modifies a refusal, order or
disallowance of the Director of Public Service and Safety or his or her
designee, or varies the application of any provision of the Building and
Housing Code, the Director or his or her designee shall take action immediately
in accordance with such decision.
   (g)   Any person aggrieved by a decision of the Board, whether or not such
person is a previous party to the decision, or any Municipal officer or
official board of the City of Wapakoneta, may apply to the appropriate court in
accordance with law.
   (h)   A non-refundable fee of two hundred dollars ($200.00) shall be
submitted with an application for a variance and to appear before the Board of
Building Code Appeals.
(Ord. 92-62. Passed 9-16-92; Ord. 2005-50. Passed 1-5-06; Ord. 2007-37. Passed
9-17-07.)

   CROSS REFERENCES

1446.04
1468.01 DANGEROUS BUILDING DEFINED.
   The term "dangerous buildings," as used in this chapter, is hereby defined
to mean and include:
   (a)   Any building, shed, fence or other man-made structure which is
dangerous to the public health because of its condition and which may cause or
aid in the spread of a disease or injury to the health of the occupants of such
structure or neighboring structures;
   (b)   Any building, shed, fence or other man-made structure which, because
of faulty construction, age, lack of proper repair or other cause, is
especially liable to fire and constitutes or creates a fire hazard;
   (c)   Any building, shed, fence or other man-made structure which, because
of faulty construction, age, lack of proper repair or other cause, constitutes
or creates a safety hazard;
   (d)   Any building, shed, fence or other man-made structure whose interior
walls or other vertical structural members list, lean or buckle to an extent
that a plumb line passing through the center of gravity falls outside the
middle third of its base;
   (e)   Any building, shed, fence or other man-made structure which has been
so damaged by fire, wind or other cause as to be dangerous to the life, safety,
morals or general health and welfare of the residents of the City;
   (f)   Any building, shed, fence or other man-made structure which, by reason
of faulty construction or any other cause, is liable to cause injury or damage
by collapsing or by the collapse or fall of any part of such structure; and
   (g)   Any building, shed, fence or other man-made structure which, because
of its condition or because of lack of doors or windows, is available to and
frequented by malefactors or disorderly persons who are not lawful occupants of
such structure.
(Ord. 92-63. Passed 9-16-92.)
1468.02 DECLARATION OF NUISANCE.
   All dangerous buildings, as defined in Section
1468.01, are hereby declared to be public nuisances.
(Ord. 92-63. Passed 9-16-92.)
1468.03 RESPONSIBILITY OF OWNERS, OCCUPANTS AND CUSTODIANS.
   No person shall maintain or permit the existence of any dangerous building
in the City. No owner, occupant or person in custody of any dangerous building
shall permit the same to remain in a dangerous condition or occupy such
building or permit it to be occupied while it is or remains in a dangerous
condition.
(Ord. 92-63. Passed 9-16-92.)
1468.04 ORDERS TO REPAIR OR RAZE.
   Whenever any building inspector, employed pursuant to Section
1440.02, or a certified Fire Safety Inspector, is of the opinion that any
building or structure in the City is a dangerous building, such official shall
thereupon cause a written order to be served upon the owner thereof, upon the
occupant thereof, and upon the holder of any encumbrance of record, to repair
and make safe said building or to raze and remove said building, at the owner's
option. Any repairs shall be made in accordance with the requirements of this
Building Code and any applicable law of the State or ordinance of the City.
(Ord. 92-63. Passed 9-16-92.)
1468.05 CONTENTS AND SERVICE OF ORDERS.
   Any order for the repair or razing of the structure as herein set forth
shall specify a time period within which the owner shall comply therewith,
which time period shall not be less than thirty days, and shall specify the
needed repairs. Said order shall be served upon the owner of record and upon
the holder of any encumbrance of record upon such real estate in the manner
provided for service of a summons by a court of record. If the owner or holder
of an encumbrance of record cannot be found, the order may be served by posting
it on the main entrance of a building and by publishing it once a week for
three successive weeks in a newspaper authorized to provide service by
publication.
(Ord. 92-63. Passed 9-16-92.)
1468.06 APPEAL OF ORDER.
   Any interested person may appeal an order to repair or raze to the Board of
Building Code Appeals following the procedure established in Section
1446.04.
(Ord. 92-63. Passed 9-16-92.)
1468.07 NONCOMPLIANCE WITH ORDER; REMEDY OF CITY.
   Whenever the owner of a property fails to comply with a repair or demolition
order within the time prescribed, the City may cause the structure or part
thereof to be repaired or razed and removed, either through an available public
agency or by contract or arrangement with private persons, and the total cost
of such repair or razing and removal shall be charged against the real estate
upon which the structure is located, in accordance with Ohio R.C. 715.26, and
shall be a lien upon such real estate. Such remedy shall be in addition to the
penalty provided in Section
1468.99.
(Ord. 92-63. Passed 9-16-92.)
1468.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
1440.99 for general Building Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)
CHAPTER 1469
Property Maintenance
1469.01   General maintenance provision.
1469.02   Definitions.
1469.03   Maintenance required.
1469.04   Repair and restoration after casualty damage.
1469.05   Dangerous building.
1469.06   Orders to comply; appeals.
 
1469.99   Penalty.
1469.01 GENERAL MAINTENANCE PROVISION.
   All buildings and structures, all parts thereof and all building services
equipment shall be maintained in accordance with Section
1469.03. Every building, occupancy or use shall comply with the provisions of
this chapter whether or not such building or use shall have been constructed,
altered or repaired before or after the enactment of this chapter.
(Ord. 2010-19-R. Passed 5-17-10.)
1469.02 DEFINITIONS.
   Unless specifically defined below, words or phrases used in this chapter
shall be interpreted so as to give them the meaning they have in common usage
and to give this chapter it's most reasonable application.
   (a)   “Dangerous building” shall be as defined in Section
1468.01.
   (b)   “Deterioration” means the condition or appearance of the exterior of
the building or part thereof, characterized by holes, breaks, rot, crumbling,
cracking, peeling, rusting, or other evidence of physical decay, neglect, or
lack of maintenance.
   (c)   “Excessive” is that which goes beyond what is proper, right, or usual.
   (d)   “Exterior” means those portions of a building which are exposed to
public view and the open space of any premises outside of any building.
   (e)   “Garbage” means animal or vegetable waste resulting from the handling,
preparation, cooking and consumption of food.
   (f)   “Infestation” means the presence of insects, rodents, vermin or other
pests on the premises which constitute a health hazard.
   (g)   “Occupant” means any person living and sleeping in a dwelling unit or
having actual possession of said dwelling unit or any person who leases or
rents a nonresidential building, structure or any portion thereof.
   (h)   “Owner” means any person, who, alone or jointly or severally with
others, shall have legal or equitable title to any premises, with or without
the accompanying actual possession thereof, or shall have charge, care or
control as owner or agent of the owner, or an executor, administrator, trustee,
receiver or guardian of the estate, or as a mortgagee in possession.
   (i)   “Person” includes any individual, corporation, association,
partnership, trustee, lessee, agent or assignee.
   (j)   “Premises” means a lot, plot or parcel of land, including the
buildings or structures thereon.
   (k)   “Refuse” means all solid wastes (except body wastes) including, but
not limited to garbage, rubbish, ashes, dead animals, industrial wastes, and an
accumulation of brush, broken glass, stumps and roots that present an
unsanitary and/or safety hazard.
   (l)   “Rubbish” means solid waste consisting of both combustible and non-
combustible wastes such as paper, wrappings, cans, yard clippings, leaves,
wood, glass, crockery, plastics and similar materials.
(Ord. 2010-19-R. Passed 5-17-10.)
1469.03 MAINTENANCE REQUIRED.
   Each owner and/or occupant shall keep all exterior components of every
structure (including but not limited to all main structures and accessory
structures) in good repair, structurally sound and sanitary, so as not to pose
a threat to the public health, safety or welfare. This includes, but is not
limited to, walls, roofs, chimneys, gutters, downspouts, drains, porches,
steps, landings, fire escapes, exterior stairs, windows, shutters, doors,
storefronts, signs, marquees, and awnings.
   (a)   All exterior wood surfaces, other than decay resistant woods, shall be
covered with a protective coating, including paint, shingles, plastic/aluminum/
asbestos or vinyl siding or other siding material so designed which preserves
the structure and does not contribute to deterioration. All exterior walls
shall be free from holes, breaks, and loose or rotting materials and maintained
weatherproof and properly surface coated where required to prevent
deterioration.
   (b)   All exterior surfaces shall be maintained free of deterioration,
including but not limited to, broken glass, loose or missing shingles or
siding, crumbling brick, stone, and mortar and peeling, scaling or deteriorated
paint.
   (c)   The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that
admit rains. Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or
deterioration in the walls or interior portion of the structure. Roof drains,
gutters and downspouts shall be maintained in good repair and free from
obstructions. Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a
public nuisance.
   (d)   Overhanging structures, including canopies, marquees, signs, awning,
exterior stairways, fire escapes, and other structures with overhanging
extensions shall be maintained in good repair and securely anchored to the
structure. All decorative features such as cornices, corbels, terra cotta trim,
and wall facings shall be maintained in good repair with proper anchorage and
in a safe condition.
   (e)   All exterior metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be
protected from rust and other signs of decay by application of a weather
protective material such as paint.
   (f)   Every exterior stairway, deck, porch and balcony, and all appurtenance
attached thereto, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair,
with proper anchorage and capable of supporting the imposed loads.
   (g)   All chimneys, cooling towers, smoke stacks, and similar appurtenances
shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.
   (h)   Every handrail and guard shall be firmly fastened and capable of
supporting normally imposed loads and shall be maintained in good condition.
   (i)   Every window, skylight, door and frame shall be kept in sound
condition, good repair and weather tight.
   (j)   Non-operative or broken electrical signs shall be repaired or removed
unless their removal decreases the value of the property. All out-of-date signs
and sign structures that bear no relationship to the present use of the
property shall be removed unless their removal decreases the value of the
property.
   (k)   All structures and buildings shall be weatherproof and shall not
harbor rodents, termites or other vermin.
   (l)   All accessory structures, including detached garages, fences and
walls, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.
   (m)   All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be
maintained in clean, safe, secure and sanitary conditions as provided herein so
as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or
safety.
   (n)   All exterior property and premises shall be kept free of excessive
accumulations of trash, garbage, waste, rubbish, refuse, and any other
substances which may cause a fire hazard or may act as a breeding place for an
infestation of vermin or insects.
   (o)   All premises shall be graded and maintained to prevent the erosion of
soil and to prevent the excessive accumulation of stagnant water thereon. All
sidewalks, walkways, stairs, driveways, parking spaces and similar areas shall
be kept in proper state or repair, and maintained free from hazardous
conditions.
   (p)   Pipes, ducts, conductors, fans or blowers shall not discharge gases,
steam, vapor, hot air, grease, smoke, odors or other gaseous or particulate
wastes directly upon abutting or adjacent public or private property or that of
another tenant so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the
public health or safety.
(Ord. 2010-19-R. Passed 5-17-10.)
1469.04 REPAIR AND RESTORATION AFTER CASUALTY DAMAGE.
   (a)   If casualty damage cannot be repaired immediately after damage, then
within a period of thirty days after casualty damage to any premises, the owner
and/or operator shall have taken the following steps:
      (1)   Contracted for the repair and restoration of damaged structures or
vegetation and the removal of debris; and/or
      (2)   Contracted for the demolition and removal of any part of the
premises not to be repaired and restored and for the removal of debris in
connection therewith.
   (b)   Such contracted work shall be completed within a reasonable time, not
to exceed ninety days. For good cause, the Director of Safety and Service or
his or her designee may extend the time for completion of work. Additional
extensions may be granted only upon a demonstration of a substantial hardship
in the completion of the repair or restoration and that property owner has made
diligent efforts to correct the damage before seeking any further extensions.
Failure to comply with the time limits or extensions granted shall be deemed a
violation of this chapter.
(Ord. 2010-19-R. Passed 5-17-10.)
1469.05 DANGEROUS BUILDING.
   When a structure or equipment is found by the Director of Safety and Service
or his or her designee to be unsafe, or when a structure is found unfit for
human occupancy, or is found unlawful, such structure shall be governed by this
and other applicable chapters of the City's codified ordinances.
(Ord. 2010-19-R. Passed 5-17-10.)
1469.06 ORDERS TO COMPLY; APPEALS.
   (a)   Orders to Comply.
      (1)   The Director of Safety and Service or his or her designee shall
enforce this chapter and shall use the procedures outlined herein. All
suspected violations and complaints shall be investigated by the Director of
Safety and Service or his or her designee and the Director of Safety and
Service or his or her designee shall issue an order to the owner of the
property upon which a violation of this chapter exists to take specific actions
that would bring the property into compliance with this chapter.
      (2)   The order shall state the corrective measures that are required to
avoid hazards to public health and safety and/or to protect adjoining or
neighboring properties from safety, fire and structural hazards and to comply
with this chapter.
      (3)   The order shall be served upon the property owner at his or her
last known address as set forth on the Real Property Tax records of the county
wherein the property is located.
      (4)   The order shall contain a date certain when such corrective
measures shall be completed which shall be no less than thirty days or more
than one year.
      (5)   At the discretion of the Director of Safety and Service or his or
her designee, where he or she finds that the purposes of this chapter would be
better served, he or she may issue a notice of conditions that require
corrections. Such notice shall contain the same information as an order,
however, such notice is not appealable nor shall disobedience of a notice be
subject to penalty. The issuance of a notice shall not in any way bar the
issuance of an order encompassing the same conditions at any time.
   (b)   Appeals.
      (1)   The property owner may appeal the order by filing a request for
appeal upon the Board of Building Code Appeals within fifteen days of the date
of the order by services of the request for appeal upon the City. If no request
for appeal is made within the time set forth herein, the right to appeal shall
be deemed as waived.
      (2)   The Board of Building Code Appeals shall consider the appeal at the
next regular meeting or within thirty days, whichever is lesser, from the date
of the request for appeal. The appeal shall address the order issued by the
Director of Safety and Service or his or her designee. The Board may adopt the
order, in whole or in part, amend the order or dismiss the order. The Board
shall not dismiss an order that allows a condition to exist that creates a
danger to any person or property of the City.
      (3)   The decision of the Board of Building Code Appeals may be appealed
by the property owner to the Court of Common Pleas.
(Ord. 2010-19-R. Passed 5-17-10.)
1469.99 PENALTY.
   Any person who shall violate any provisions of this chapter or fail to
comply with any of its requirements, or who shall erect, construct, alter,
repair or do any work upon or in connection with, any buildings or structures
in violation of a plan therefore or disobey any order or directive relating
thereto approved or made by the Director of Service and Safety or his or her
designee, or of a permit or certificate issued under this chapter, shall be
punishable by a fine of not more than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) or by
imprisonment for not more than thirty days, or both; such fine and imprisonment
shall be for each provision of law thus violated. Each day that any such
violation or failure continues shall be deemed a separate offense.
(Ord. 2010-19-R. Passed 5-17-10.)
CHAPTER 1476
Flood Damage Prevention
1476.01   Findings of fact.
